case_vignette: A 7-year-old child is brought to the emergency room by his parents in severe pain. They state that he fell on his outstretched right arm while playing with his friends. He is unable to move his right arm which is being supported by his left. On exam, his vitals are normal. His right extremity reveals normal pulses without swelling in any compartments, but there is crepitus above the elbow upon movement. The child is able to flex and extend his wrist, but this is limited by pain. The child has decreased sensation along his thumb and is unable to make the "OK" sign with his thumb and index finger.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm in severe pain and can't move my right arm after falling on it.
Can you describe the type of pain and its exact location?
The pain is above my elbow, and it's a really bad pain that gets worse when I try to move my arm.
Did you hear a snap or crack when you fell on your arm?
Yes, when I move my arm, it makes a crackling sound.
Are you able to move your fingers, and do you have any numbness or tingling in your arm?
I can move my fingers, but my thumb feels numb and I can't make the "OK" sign with my thumb and index finger.
Did you experience any swelling, bruising, or visible deformity in the area above your elbow after the fall?
There's no swelling, but it really hurts above my elbow when it's moved.
How long ago did you fall and injure your arm?
I fell today while playing with my friends.
Have you taken any pain medication since the injury occurred?
No, I haven't taken any pain medication.
Do you have any medical conditions or are you currently on any medication that may affect your bone density or healing?
I'm just a patient describing my current symptoms; I can't provide any information on medical conditions or medications.
Understood. Do you have any previous history of bone or joint injuries in the affected arm?
No, this is the first time I've hurt my arm.

Given the symptoms and circumstances, I recommend you seek immediate medical attention.

**Final Diagnosis:**
Possible fracture of the arm with potential accompanying nerve injury (indicated by numbness and inability to perform certain movements). An X-ray and proper physical examination are necessary to confirm the diagnosis and address potential nerve involvement.

**Final Diagnosis:** Possible fracture or severe sprain of the right arm with potential nerve involvement.
